thread.title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger on why Gunners can knock out Bayern Munich | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger on why Gunners can knock out Bayern Munich | Metro News

author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger on why Gunners can knock out Bayern Munich | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 9:36 am Arsene Wenger is confident of a better result against Bayern Munich (Picture: Getty) 
Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger has explained why he feels his side may be better equipped to cope with Bayern Munich this season than in previous years. Wenger to drop key star in risky tactical change vs Bayern Munich 
The Gunners have a poor record against tonight’s Champions League opponents, having been knocked out of the competition by them in both 2012/13 and 2013/14. 
Arsenal also met the Bavarians in the group stages last season, beating them 2-0 at home but suffering a crushing 5-1 defeat in their trip to the Allianz Arena. Wenger’s side lost 5-1 on their last trip to the Allianz Arena (Picture: Getty) 
Still, Wenger is optimistic that his players have more experience of these tough fixtures now, and that they could benefit from having the second leg of this tie at home. 
‘I feel we have experience. We play against a Bayern side who, every year, have the same task, which is to win the Champions League,’ Wenger said.
